pullRequest.body:
Notably, define the pullback of vector fields, and show that the pullback of a differentiable vector field under a C^2 map is differentiable.

More API to come in further PRs. Once all the API is there, it will be easy to define the Lie algebra of a Lie group using left-invariant vector fields, in #18396.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [f5508a1837](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20639/commits/f5508a1837a7fe8cfb7b416aed3db9e6f57612f3)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.VectorField` (new file)|1811|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ContinuousLinearMap.IsInvertible.contDiffAt_map_inverse`
`+ _root_.MDifferentiable.mpullback_vectorField`
`+ _root_.MDifferentiableAt.mpullback_vectorField`
`+ _root_.MDifferentiableOn.mpullbackWithin_vectorField_inter`
`+ _root_.MDifferentiableOn.mpullback_vectorField_preimage`
`+ _root_.MDifferentiableWithinAt.mpullbackWithin_vectorField_inter`
`+ _root_.MDifferentiableWithinAt.mpullbackWithin_vectorField_inter_of_eq`
`+ _root_.MDifferentiableWithinAt.mpullback_vectorField_preimage`
`+ _root_.MDifferentiableWithinAt.mpullback_vectorField_preimage_of_eq`
`+ instance [IsManifold I (minSmoothness ùïú 1) M] :`
`+ instance [IsManifold I (minSmoothness ùïú 2) M] :`
`+ instance [IsManifold I (minSmoothness ùïú 3) M] :`
`+ instance {n : ‚Ñï} [n.AtLeastTwo] [IsManifold I (minSmoothness ùïú (ofNat(n))) M] :`
`+ minSmoothness_add`
`+ minSmoothness_eq_infty`
`+ minSmoothness_monotone`
`+ mpullback`
`+ mpullbackWithin`
`+ mpullbackWithin_add`
`+ mpullbackWithin_add_apply`
`+ mpullbackWithin_apply`
`+ mpullbackWithin_eq_pullbackWithin`
`+ mpullbackWithin_id`
`+ mpullbackWithin_neg`
`+ mpullbackWithin_neg_apply`
`+ mpullbackWithin_smul`
`+ mpullbackWithin_smul_apply`
`+ mpullbackWithin_univ`
`+ mpullback_add`
`+ mpullback_add_apply`
`+ mpullback_apply`
`+ mpullback_eq_pullback`
`+ mpullback_id`
`+ mpullback_neg`
`+ mpullback_neg_apply`
`+ mpullback_smul`
`+ mpullback_smul_apply`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
awaiting-author
Thanks for the review! I have taken all your comments into account, and left open the ones where there was something to say.

:v: sgouezel can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
I took a first look: very nice. I didn't scrutinise the long main proof so far.

Some superficial remarks about doc strings but thanks to previous review I think this is now ready.

bors d+
I took a first look: very nice. I didn't scrutinise the long main proof so far.

Some superficial remarks about doc strings but thanks to previous review I think this is now ready.

bors d+
Optional: you could combine this line and the next one.
"vector space"?
up to you if you want to remove the line break before this line (and also below)
No, it's on purpose: I want to keep things cleanly separated.

Should these instances go in another file?
Should they be scoped (to e.g. the `Manifold` or `VectorField` namespace)?

The current file is the first file importing both `IsManifold` and `minSmoothness`. And I don't think they should be scoped; since they are `IsManifold` instances, they will never interfere with anything not on manifolds.
How about adding the `smul` versions also? (You only have them for `mpullbackWithin`.)
Add the same result for `mpullbackWithin`?
Add the same result for `mpullback`?
You're saying "general" twice in this paragraph.
Is completeness required? For which results? (Can you add a comment, if this is merely fore convenience?)

This doc-string doesn't match the statement. Can you update it, please?
(The statement of the doc-string would also be nice, though. Is that part of a future PR?)
Yes, it's part of the next PR. Copy-paste mistake, presumably. Fixed.

give this section a name (also update the `end`), perhaps this?
```suggestion
section Regularity

Given that this is a wrong-way map, I think we should highlight how it can exist. Maybe something like:
```suggestion
Note that the pullback uses the junk-value pattern: if the derivative of the map is not invertible,
then pullback is given the junk value zero.
```
(I appreciate this is already flagged one level down in the documentation for affine story, but I think it deserves repeating here.)
Again, I'd probably flag the junk-value pattern here and in `mpullback` below.
I note that the documentation is a little ahead of the PR sequencing here (since `mlieBracket` does not yet exist) but IMHO this is fine as the final PR is now close.

pullRequest.title: feat: start building an API for vector fields on manifolds
